summary: Context Architecture is an Atlanta-based consulting business founded by CJ Mitchell in 2025 that helps individuals and SMBs structure their knowledge so AI tools can use it effectively. The company solves the 'Midas Problem' where AI gives exactly what was asked for but not what was meant due to lack of context. Their competitive advantage is methodology for structuring domain-specific knowledge into queryable systems, with the knowledge layer serving as their defensible moat while voice technology becomes commoditized.
products_services: Foundation tier: discovery sessions, ontology design, knowledge graph creation, MCP integration
Voice Layer tier: custom voice persona creation, real-time voice interfaces
Digital Twin tier: personality capture, expertise preservation
context-engine: open source CLI tool for text to structured JSON pipeline

key_people.name: CJ Mitchell
key_people.context: Founded Context Architecture in Atlanta, Georgia in 2025

customers.target: individuals and small to medium businesses
segments: law firms losing institutional knowledge when senior partners retire
financial advisory practices needing voice AI with client portfolio knowledge
healthcare practices wanting AI that understands patient history
real estate brokerages needing property knowledge systems

competitive_position: Methodology-focused differentiation where the process of structuring domain-specific knowledge into queryable systems serves as the defensible moat, while underlying AI models and voice technology are commoditized
key_facts: Revenue model is project-based consulting with recurring maintenance contracts
Core problem addressed is the 'Midas Problem' where AI lacks context about user identity and actual needs
Founding thesis: voice layer is commoditizing but knowledge layer is the moat
First product is context-engine, an open source CLI tool
